title: Build comprehensive professional company website for Aparna Natural Millets Producer Co. Ltd.

requirements.text: Create a Hero/Home section featuring the company name 'Aparna Natural Millets Producer Co. Ltd.', tagline 'Powered by Farmers. Trusted by Families.', and a compelling headline about the 1 TPD Millet Processing Unit project in Rayagada, Odisha

quotes: Aparna Natural Millets Producer Co. Ltd.
Powered by Farmers. Trusted by Families.
Establishment of a 1 TPD Millet Processing Unit

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays company name prominently
Tagline is visible and well-positioned
Includes engaging headline about the processing unit project

requirements.text: Build an About the Company section explaining the farmer-owned cooperative model, alignment with Odisha Millets Mission (OMM) and PMFME scheme, and the mission to empower tribal farmers while enhancing nutrition in Rayagada

quotes: compact, farmer-owned millet processing unit designed and promoted by the Board of Directors
aligns directly with the Odisha Millets Mission (OMM) and the Central PMFME scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Section explains the farmer-owned cooperative structure
Mentions alignment with OMM and PMFME schemes
Describes mission to empower tribal farmers and enhance nutrition

requirements.text: Create a Project Vision & Core Objectives section presenting the vision statement and three core objectives: Assured Procurement (transparent procurement at fairer prices for 500+ FPC members), Post-harvest Loss Reduction (primary and secondary processing to reduce losses and increase marketable value), and Nutrition & Supply (manufacture high-quality millet products for ICDS, Mid-Day Meals, and tribal hostels)

quotes: To create a sustainable, farmer-owned value chain in Rayagada
Provide transparent, timely procurement at fairer prices directly to 500+ FPC members

acceptanceCriteria: Vision statement is clearly displayed
All three core objectives are presented with their descriptions
Specific details like 500+ FPC members and target programs (ICDS, MDM) are included

requirements.text: Build a Why Rayagada section explaining the local context (Rayagada as a leading producer of Ragi and minor millets), current market challenges with intermediaries, benefits of local processing to retain value in the district, and projected social impact reaching 500+ direct farmer beneficiaries and thousands of consumers through institutional procurement

quotes: Rayagada district is a leading producer of Ragi and other minor millets
sold to intermediaries for low margins

acceptanceCriteria: Explains Rayagada's role as a millet producer
Describes current market inefficiencies
Details benefits of local value-add processing
Shows projected social impact with specific beneficiary numbers

requirements.text: Create a Technical Specifications section showcasing the 1 TPD processing design with four key components: Pre-cleaning & Grading (multi-stage aspiration and sieving), De-huller & Destoner (efficient de-hulling with integrated destoner), Pulverizer (variable gap pulverizer for coarse and fine flours), and Roaster & Automatic Packaging (controlled roasting with automated weighing and pouch sealing). Include details about ancillary systems and modular expansion plans to 2-3 TPD

quotes: modular expansion to 2–3 TPD in Phase II

acceptanceCriteria: All four main processing components are described with their functions
Technical details about each stage are included
Mentions ancillary systems (cold storage, quality lab)
Notes modular expansion capability to 2-3 TPD

requirements.text: Build a Financial Overview section presenting Total Project Cost (₹1.15 Crore), Means of Finance breakdown (Bank Loan: ₹70.00 Lakhs, Promoter Contribution: ₹4.75 Lakhs, PMFME Subsidy 35%: ₹40.25 Lakhs), and Year 1 projections (Revenue: ₹1.50 Crore, Net Profit: ₹35 Lakhs)
acceptanceCriteria: Total project cost is clearly stated
All funding sources are listed with amounts
Year 1 revenue and profit projections are displayed
Financial information is presented in a professional, digestible format

requirements.text: Create a Social & Economic Impact section highlighting three areas: Employment & Inclusion (15 direct jobs for local tribal youth and women), Farmer Livelihoods & Income (increased incomes through assured procurement for 500+ member base), and Nutrition & Local Food Security (supplying hygienic milled millet products to ICDS and MDM to address anemia and child nutrition)

quotes: 15 direct jobs prioritized for local tribal youth and women
Increased farmer incomes through assured procurement
Supplying hygienic, milled millet products to ICDS and MDM

acceptanceCriteria: All three impact areas are clearly presented
Specific numbers (15 jobs, 500+ farmers) are included
Nutrition and food security benefits are explained
Impact on tribal communities is emphasized

requirements.text: Build a Market Strategy section presenting three channels: B2G (Institutional Offtake to ICDS, Mid-Day Meals, Tribal Hostels), B2B (Retail & Mission Outlets including Odisha Millets Mission outlets and cooperative stores with 25kg bulk SKUs), and B2C (Brand 'Aparna Millets' with 1kg retail SKUs, local-language labeling, and digital outreach targeting health-conscious urban buyers in Odisha)
acceptanceCriteria: All three market channels (B2G, B2B, B2C) are described
Target buyers and product SKUs for each channel are specified
Brand 'Aparna Millets' consumer positioning is explained
Sustainability levers are mentioned

requirements.text: Create a Value Chain Process section illustrating the end-to-end workflow with five stages: Aggregation (farmer collection and scheduled procurement), Cleaning (primary cleaning to reduce contamination), Processing (de-hulling, milling and roasting operations), and Dispatch (packaging, quality checks and delivery). Include operational KPI targets for Year 1: procurement coverage for 500 members, ≤5% post-harvest loss, product moisture ≤10%, and institutional delivery lead time ≤7 days

quotes: procurement coverage for 500 members, ≤5% post-harvest loss

acceptanceCriteria: All five value chain stages are presented in sequence
Each stage's function is described
Year 1 operational KPI targets are displayed
Visual or structured flow representation of the process

requirements.text: Build a Support Requested section addressing government and district administration with four specific requests: Administrative Guidance (facilitate PMFME subsidy clearance and verification visits), Procurement Convergence (inclusion in district procurement lists for ICDS/MDM and tribal hostels), Land & Infrastructure Assistance (help identify industrial shed or expedite clearances), and Linkages & Capacity Building (facilitate introductions to state procurement officers and training collaborations)
acceptanceCriteria: All four support requests are clearly articulated
Each request is specific and actionable
Target audience (Collectorate & District Administration) is clear
Request for district-level meeting with 60-90 day timeline is included

requirements.text: Create a Conclusion & Next Steps section outlining three phases: Phase 1 Commissioning (0-3 months: finalize site, install machinery, recruit staff, secure PMFME subsidy), Phase 2 Operationalization (3-9 months: begin procurement cycles, achieve 70% capacity utilization, obtain institutional trial orders), and Phase 3 Scale & Consolidate (9-24 months: expand market reach, introduce fortified SKUs, pursue certification, plan Phase II capacity uplift to 2-3 TPD)
acceptanceCriteria: All three phases are presented with timeframes
Key activities for each phase are listed
Progressive scale-up from commissioning to consolidation is clear
Phase II capacity expansion to 2-3 TPD is mentioned

requirements.text: Build a Contact section displaying contact information for Bibhuti Bhusana Mishra (Phone: +919437372707, Email: bibhuti4011@gmail.com) and including an interactive contact form with fields for name, email, phone, subject/inquiry type, and message. The form should allow government officials, investors, and potential customers to submit inquiries

quotes: contact form for inquiries from government officials, investors, and customers

acceptanceCriteria: Contact information for Bibhuti Bhusana Mishra is displayed
Interactive contact form includes all required fields
Form is functional and can collect inquiry submissions
Contact section is easily accessible from navigation

requirements.text: Implement a professional, trustworthy visual design theme that reflects agricultural heritage, cooperative values, and modern processing capabilities. Use warm, earthy tones (avoid blue and purple) inspired by millets and grain, incorporate subtle textures or patterns suggesting farmland or grain processing, and ensure the design conveys both grassroots authenticity and professional credibility suitable for government officials, investors, and customers
acceptanceCriteria: Color palette uses warm, earthy tones appropriate for agricultural cooperative
Design balances grassroots authenticity with professional credibility
Visual theme is consistent across all sections
Layout and typography support readability for diverse audience (officials, investors, customers)

requirements.text: Create a responsive navigation system that allows easy access to all major sections (Home, About, Project Vision, Why Rayagada, Technical Specifications, Financial Overview, Social Impact, Market Strategy, Value Chain, Support Requested, Contact) and ensure the entire website is mobile-responsive for viewing on phones and tablets
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation menu includes links to all major sections
Navigation is accessible and functional on all screen sizes
Website layout adapts properly to mobile and tablet viewports
All content sections are accessible and readable on smaller screens

constraints: Use React with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS for frontend implementation
Contact form should collect inquiries but does not need to integrate with external email services
All company information must exactly match the details provided in the source document
Financial figures must be displayed exactly as specified (₹1.15 Crore total cost, ₹1.50 Crore Year 1 revenue, etc.)
nonGoals: E-commerce functionality for selling millet products directly
Real-time inventory or order tracking systems
Multi-language translation beyond the single primary language
Backend API for contact form submission processing
